intro: Amphilophis pertusa var. barbata, commonly known as the barbed amphilophis, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive barbed bracts that surround its showy, pink to purple flowers. It typically grows in moist, sunny habitats such as riverbanks and wetlands. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural study and ecological research.
